verses.verse: Now the serpent <S%H5175><s%> was <S%H1961><s%> more subtle <S%H6175><s%> than any animal <S%H2416><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> which the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had made <S%H6213><s%>. And he said <S%H559><s%> unto the woman <S%H802><s%>, Yes <S%H637><s%>, has God <S%H430><s%> really said <S%H559><s%>, You shall not eat <S%H398><s%> of every tree <S%H6086><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%>?
And the woman <S%H802><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the serpent <S%H5175><s%>, We may eat <S%H398><s%> of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%>:

But of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%> which is in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%>, God <S%H430><s%> has said <S%H559><s%>, You shall not eat <S%H398><s%> of it <S%H5060><s%>, neither shall you touch it <S%H6435><s%>, lest you die <S%H4191><s%>.
And the serpent <S%H5175><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the woman <S%H802><s%>, You shall not surely <S%H4191><s%> die <S%H4191><s%>:

For God <S%H430><s%> does know <S%H3045><s%> that in the day <S%H3117><s%> you eat <S%H398><s%> it <S%H5869><s%>, then your eyes shall be opened <S%H6491><s%>, and you will be as gods <S%H430><s%>, knowing <S%H3045><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> and evil <S%H7451><s%>.

And when the woman <S%H802><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that the tree <S%H6086><s%> was good <S%H2896><s%> for food <S%H3978><s%>, and that it <S%H1931><s%> was pleasant <S%H8378><s%> to the eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and a tree <S%H6086><s%> to be desired <S%H2530><s%> to make one wise <S%H7919><s%>, she took <S%H3947><s%> of the fruit of it <S%H6529><s%>, and did eat <S%H398><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> to her husband <S%H376><s%> with her <S%H398><s%>; and he did eat.

And the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of them both <S%H8147><s%> were opened <S%H6491><s%>, and they <S%H1992><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> that they were naked <S%H5903><s%>; and they sewed <S%H8609><s%> fig <S%H8384><s%> leaves <S%H5929><s%> together <S%H8609><s%>, and made themselves <S%H6213><s%> aprons <S%H2290><s%>.

And they heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> in the garden <S%H1588><s%> in the cool <S%H7307><s%> of the day <S%H3117><s%>: and Adam <S%H120><s%> and his wife <S%H802><s%> hid themselves <S%H2244><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%>.
And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> unto Adam <S%H120><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H335><s%>, Where are you?

And he said <S%H559><s%>, I heard <S%H8085><s%> your voice <S%H6963><s%> in the garden <S%H1588><s%>, and I was afraid <S%H3372><s%>, because I <S%H595><s%> was naked <S%H5903><s%>; and I hid myself <S%H2244><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Who <S%H4310><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> you that you were naked <S%H5903><s%>? Have you eaten <S%H398><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%> that I commanded you <S%H6680><s%> that you should not <S%H1115><s%> eat <S%H398><s%>?

And the man <S%H120><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, The woman <S%H802><s%> whom you gave <S%H5414><s%> to be with me <S%H5978><s%>, she <S%H1931><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> me of the tree <S%H6086><s%>, and I did eat <S%H398><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto the woman <S%H802><s%>, What is this that you have done <S%H6213><s%>? And the woman <S%H802><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, The serpent <S%H5175><s%> deceived me <S%H5377><s%>, and I did eat <S%H398><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto the serpent <S%H5175><s%>, Because you <S%H859><s%> have done <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H779><s%>, you are cursed above all cattle <S%H929><s%>, and above every animal <S%H2416><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>; upon your belly <S%H1512><s%> shall you go <S%H3212><s%>, and dust <S%H6083><s%> shall you eat <S%H398><s%> all the days <S%H3117><s%> of your life <S%H2416><s%>:

And I will put <S%H7896><s%> enmity <S%H342><s%> between you and the woman <S%H802><s%>, and between your seed <S%H2233><s%> and her seed <S%H2233><s%>; He shall bruise <S%H7779><s%> your head <S%H7218><s%>, and you shall bruise <S%H7779><s%> his heel <S%H6119><s%>.

To the woman <S%H802><s%> he said <S%H559><s%>, I will greatly <S%H7235><s%> multiply <S%H7235><s%> your pain <S%H6093><s%> in your pregnancy <S%H2032><s%>; in sorrow <S%H6089><s%> you shall bring forth <S%H3205><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%>; and your desire <S%H8669><s%> shall be to your husband <S%H376><s%>, and he shall rule over you <S%H4910><s%>.

And to Adam <S%H121><s%> he said <S%H559><s%>, Because you have listened <S%H8085><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of your wife <S%H802><s%>, and have eaten <S%H398><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%>, of which <S%H834><s%> I commanded you <S%H6680><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, You shall not eat <S%H398><s%> of it <S%H779><s%>: cursed is the ground <S%H127><s%> for your sake <S%H6093><s%>; in sorrow shall you eat <S%H398><s%> of it all <S%H3605><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of your life <S%H2416><s%>;
Thorns also <S%H6975><s%> and thistles <S%H1863><s%> shall it bring forth <S%H6779><s%> to you <S%H398><s%>; and you shall eat the herb <S%H6212><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>;

By the sweat <S%H2188><s%> of your face <S%H639><s%> shall you eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>, until <S%H5704><s%> you return <S%H7725><s%> to the ground <S%H127><s%>; for out of it were you taken <S%H3947><s%>: for dust <S%H6083><s%> you <S%H859><s%> are <S%H6083><s%>, and to dust shall you return <S%H7725><s%>.
And Adam <S%H120><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%>'s name <S%H8034><s%> Eve <S%H2332><s%>; because she was the mother <S%H517><s%> of all living <S%H2416><s%>.
To Adam <S%H120><s%> also and to his wife <S%H802><s%> did the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> coats <S%H3801><s%> of skins <S%H5785><s%>, and clothed them <S%H3847><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Behold <S%H2005><s%>, the man <S%H120><s%> is become as one <S%H259><s%> of us <S%H3045><s%>, to know good <S%H2896><s%> and evil <S%H7451><s%>: and now <S%H7971><s%>, lest he put forth his hand <S%H3027><s%>, and take <S%H3947><s%> also of the tree <S%H6086><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%>, and eat <S%H398><s%>, and live <S%H2425><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>:

Therefore the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> sent him forth <S%H7971><s%> from the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Eden <S%H5731><s%>, to until <S%H5647><s%> the ground <S%H127><s%> from which he was taken <S%H3947><s%>.

So he drove out <S%H1644><s%> the man <S%H120><s%>; and he placed <S%H7931><s%> at the east <S%H6924><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Eden <S%H5731><s%> Cherubims <S%H3742><s%>, and a flaming <S%H3858><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%> which turned every way <S%H2015><s%>, to guard <S%H8104><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%>.
